title: Google\Cloud\Bigtable\Admin\V2\Snapshot
name: Snapshot
description:
A snapshot of a table at a particular time. A snapshot can be used as a checkpoint for data restoration or a data source for a new table.

Note: This is a private alpha release of Cloud Bigtable snapshots. This feature is not currently available to most Cloud Bigtable customers. This feature might be changed in backward-incompatible ways and is not recommended for production use. It is not subject to any SLA or deprecation policy.

Generated from protobuf message google.bigtable.admin.v2.Snapshot

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The unique name of the snapshot. Values are of the form projects/{project}/instances/{instance}/clusters/{cluster}/snapshots/{snapshot}.

params.name: data.source_table
params.description: Output only. The source table at the time the snapshot was taken.

params.name: data.data_size_bytes
params.description: Output only. The size of the data in the source table at the time the snapshot was taken. In some cases, this value may be computed asynchronously via a background process and a placeholder of 0 will be used in the meantime.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time when the snapshot is created.

params.name: data.delete_time
params.description: Output only. The time when the snapshot will be deleted. The maximum amount of time a snapshot can stay active is 365 days. If 'ttl' is not specified, the default maximum of 365 days will be used.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current state of the snapshot.
